website_summaries.verdict: A sophisticated dispenser with thoughtful design elements, but the battery power they draw is not insignificant.
pros: This soap dispenser delivers soap quickly, and triggers in a specific zone, so it's predictable
Its drip-free silicone valve prevents messy drips on your counters
Users can adjust the amount dispensed
Clear storage tanks make it easy to see when it's time to refill
cons: May need to dilute some soaps to avoid clogging the dispenser
Battery use may increase as dispenser ages - uses 4 AA batteries

customer_reviews.title: If you buy it for decoration it's OK. Otherwise.... Don't
customer_reviews.text: Device behaves erratically. No way to know if it's on or off. No way to know if it's charged or when it needs charging, It goes on or off without any apparent reason... Beautiful design so, if it's for decoration only it's ok. If it's for any practical use: a waste of money. Update: 9-10-19: Contacted simplehuman support. Got instructions to reset. Did it. No dice. Now it's completely dead.... after just an occasional use for 4 months.. I'm hopping for a replacement or at least a repair....
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth Daly

customer_reviews.title: Battery Hog.  Not recommended.
customer_reviews.text: This unit worked fine for a while. Now its eating batteries every three weeks. I'm spending way more on batteries than the cost of the unit. Other users claim the same issue. I would not purchase this unit.
customer_reviews.author: KMV

customer_reviews.title: One in every sink area in the house!
customer_reviews.text: We have four of these at home - that's how much we like this product! You can either use the simple human soap or any other liquid soap you like. You can also change how much soap you'd like coming out in one shot. It takes 4 AA batteries.
customer_reviews.author: Tricia G

customer_reviews.title: Disappointment AGAIN. simple-human Señor Pump failed again
customer_reviews.text: I own 3 of the last generation of their simple human, Saw their new one, rechargeable, Nice finishing, gave them one more chance, the soap señor disappointed me a big time, It worked perfectly for more than a month until yesterday, thought is low battery, The soap game out once after I charge it, now stop working.... I m very frustrated. How come is so unreliable... am I the only one ? 20-APR 2020 , AMAOZN replaced that one for me , it works well until last night, it die on me. $ 60 is not a cheap sensor dispenser. ( tried out all the trouble shooting solution ... )
customer_reviews.author: Honest review

customer_reviews.title: Slow Drip :(
customer_reviews.text: This is the second simplehuman 8 oz. Sensor Pump with Soap I have owned. I was so disappointed in this product. It has a nice slow drip leak of soap on my counter; which then in turn clogs up the spout. I'm returning and I'm hoping it is this just this bad lemon soap dispenser. My last one I had I had for 5 years plus.
customer_reviews.author: kuebel4

customer_reviews.title: Ordered two NEW soap dispensers. Received one that was Used and Dirty.
customer_reviews.text: We purchased our first Simplehuman soap dispenser at Bed, Bath, and Beyond. We've used it for several months now and it's great! So we decided to order two more from Amazon. One arrived new and clean (the brass color is very beautiful), but the other one was used, dirty, and gross (and not the model we ordered, although the correct color). It was in the correct box (model ST1055) of the one we ordered, which seems very odd. Simplehuman should tape their boxes so that we, as consumers, will know if it’s a returned product (and we will know that it's a used and/or defective product before opening the box).
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Better But Still Not Right
customer_reviews.text: The only problem with this soap dispenser is that the capacity is tiny. In addition, there is no way to tell when the soap is running low because you can't see the soap in the dispenser. Other Simple Human battery operated dispensers i have owned eat batteries much too rapidly. This rechargeable model holds a charge for a reasonable period, but holds so little soap that it needs to be refilled much too often. Maybe the next iteration will get both things right: adequate capacity and long life for batteries. The appearance of this model is excellent.
customer_reviews.author: kbppwcj

customer_reviews.title: Looks and works great!
customer_reviews.text: I use it with Softsoap hand soap. Works great every time since day one. Comes with USB cable for charging but USB power adapter is not included (you can use any USB power adapter or just plug the cable to computer USB port).
customer_reviews.author: Mitch R. Marek

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Loved this product... for a short time. My first dispenser quit working after the soap delivery line split after less than a year. The seller replaced it free of charge and I was very happy. Until today... when I discovered that the reason why I was not getting any soap to dispense was not a battery issue but rather all of the soap had leaked out of the unit and pooled in the dish that I thankfully had the dispenser sitting in. I can’t even figure out where it is leaking from or why. It’s very disappointing as the concept is good and Simplehuman has had a good reputation for quality products.
customer_reviews.author: Tracey

customer_reviews.title: Fits perfectly in a size ‘R’ liner.
customer_reviews.text: Pros: It’s pretty. It’s rechaegable. Cons: Operates best as a paperweight. Enjoys playing reverse Russian roulette. Triggers from steam. Doesn’t dispense soap. Please send trash can development team over to the soap dispenser department.
customer_reviews.author: +rp

customer_reviews.title: It stops working after about 2 months- But Support is good and quick
customer_reviews.text: It stops working after about two months. Everyone that provided similar feedback is legit. The quality is great on the outside but it will just stop working right about when you're fresh into the second refill. seems like the culprit is the charging system. I got a replacement which is working fine so far, will see if this lasts over 6 months and beyond
customer_reviews.author: Mace Vindaloo

customer_reviews.title: They look sleek and neat and work perfectly
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these to sit at opposite ends of my kitchen sink- one for Dawn dishwashing liquid and the other for hand soap. They work perfectly every time and dispense as much liquid as you want by adjusting the plus or minus buttons at the top of the dispenser. Very happy with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: G. Kelley

customer_reviews.title: I just got soap dispenser today and already find a ...
customer_reviews.text: I just got soap dispenser today and already find a malfunction regards its Power On/Off After I turn off the device (with red light indicator), it just wouldn't allow me to turn it back on. In other words, no green light is on after Press & Hold + button. It is so not money worth......... Will not purchase any Simplehuman products.
customer_reviews.author: Zhe Zhang

customer_reviews.title: Only good as long as it works
customer_reviews.text: Only good as long as it works. Have owned about 5-6. Bought from Macy’s and Bed, Bath, and Beyond. Got tired of putting in batteries. Purchased 2. One I returned. The other just lasted until the warranty ran out. Bought from Amazon just about a couple of months ago and planning to get refund. Using Simple Human soapbut it gets thick and frustrating to try and get any soap out. Giving up on these. Too much work and too little soap .👎🏻
customer_reviews.author: JoannEnchanted

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it. Horrible sensor
customer_reviews.text: Got it today.. returning tomorrow. Very disappointed with this soap dispenser. The sensor is awful and doesn’t sense when my hand or sponge are near the sensor. It’s also pretty much impossible to see how much soap is left in the tank unless you pick it up and look from the bottom. I was hoping it would be a better option than the last generation with the rechargeable battery but I’d rather go with the older model that actually works. Don’t waste your money on this product
customer_reviews.author: Birte Gunnarsson

customer_reviews.title: A lemon?
customer_reviews.text: I bought 2 Simple Human, rechargeable, touchless hand soap dispensers for my home on March 2020. The rose gold one took 13 hours to charge. It worked fine for about a month, then worked only intermittently. And sometimes it would charge, other times it wouldn't, for no apparent reason. It finally stopped working altogether on 9/18/20. In sum, it lasted about 6 months, and didn't operate 100% for those 6 months. It must have been a dud. The white one I bought around the same time is still working perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Broke already
customer_reviews.text: This lasted less then a year. What broke was the battery coil so it no longer gets power. I have never had an issues with a battery compartment on ANY thing I have ever bought. This thing is expensive and should have been built better. I did get a new version of the one that you plus in to a usb charger. That has worked good so far. Stay away from the older type one.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Rechargeable dispenser
customer_reviews.text: I had a Simply Human battery operated soap dispenser which broke on me so I replaced it with the rechargeable one. Nicer design, about the same capacity, good charge life. The only issue is it seems to dispense the same amount of soap no matter where you place your hands. It’s suppose to be a sliding scale. Otherwise, great product.
customer_reviews.author: Mddoodle

customer_reviews.title: Looks awesome and works as expected!
customer_reviews.text: Looks great and works amazingly. Pro tip: you can use with most soaps and detergents ;)
customer_reviews.author: sfelipe

customer_reviews.title: 3 year lifespan.  Some issues
customer_reviews.text: Used for kitchen sink over the past 3 years. Performance is good, but a couple of issues. The rubber-tipped dispenser can get clogged, causing soap to shoot off at an angle. Wiping that tip with fingers or sponge clears up the problem but has caused the rubber to rip. Another issue, which I cannot explain, is that it will not work with high quality rechargeable batteries - only single use duracells.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Don’t waste your money
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this 5 months ago. And now it’s dead! Won’t work at all. Tired charging it, nothing. Tired turning off and back on, nothing. Battery holds a charge if you’re lucky a month. Motion sensor is almost to sensitive, had to move it away from the sink because it would go off when washing your hands. I would have expected better quality for this $$$
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It is good but be aware that it wastes too much soap.
customer_reviews.text: This soap dispenser is nice generally speaking but unfortunately it dispenses too much soap even at the lowest setting. I was planning to buy three more units but that will not happened because of this design mistake. I have three units of the previous model which operates with regular AA batteries which has better range of the soap amount desired. Thank you.
customer_reviews.author: Gocel

customer_reviews.title: A one year review. DONT BUY!
customer_reviews.text: One year and 5 days of normal usage and both of the dispensers I purchased have quit working. In the year they worked here are my thoughts: • The soap amount adjustment either puts out too much or too little. 3/5 * They go through batteries pretty quickly. 2/5 • They don't drip. 5/5 • The sensor works on the first try most of the time. 4/5 * They don't last. 0/5 I have several Simple Human products in my house that I love and I LIKED these despite their flaws. Now that they quit working I hate them. I would advise against purchasing and look for another brand with better ratings and a lower cost.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph M.

customer_reviews.title: Started leaking after 6 months
customer_reviews.text: Started leaking after 6 months. before that it worked great never leaked a drop. Only other complaint is the sensor isn't real sensitive if putting anything other than hand under it. Like you want to squirt soap in cup. you'll have to put finger behind cup to activate..
customer_reviews.author: allenk

customer_reviews.title: Started great!! Now devours batteries!
customer_reviews.text: I like the design, capacity and adjustability. If I had written this review in the first six months it would’ve been five stars. However 18 months in the unit started devouring batteries. I have tried rechargeable disposable and multiple brands. Now I’m lucky if a battery will run it for 10 days. When I started it would run at least 6 to 8 weeks. I thought I was investing in a quality brand, unfortunately now I’m looking for a replacement. Disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Close to perfect!
customer_reviews.text: Works fantastically. Was unaware of the measured dispense feature based on your distance from the nozzle, and so that was an added bonus I love. Only complaints are the proprietary charge cable which is a deathnell for the unit if lost and the lack of a soap level view window on the side. I would have designed a rubber cover for a standard mini-usb or some such if I had designed it myself, but otherwise it's a great unit.
customer_reviews.author: --LD

customer_reviews.title: Great product, previous generation was slightly better
customer_reviews.text: PROS: + rechargeable + sensor based distribution of soap CONS: - The previous product had an adjustment for the amount of soap. This had a greater range of how much soap to dispense - Anti-Drip nozzle seems to have some soap always at the end of it, unlike previous generation - more expensive (50 dollars is at the high-point of what id be willing to pay for these... There are variants online for 18$ (thought battery operated) - Cannot see soap left in the unit, filling is somewhat less convenient
customer_reviews.author: Ross

customer_reviews.title: Junk after 4 months
customer_reviews.text: I've had this dispenser for all of four months. Today, after turning it off to clean the counter under it, it wouldn't turn back on. After plugging it in, it proceeded to begin dumping all of the soap in it. I got soap all over the table, the carpet, and other electronics it was plugged in near before I could get a hand under it and run it to the sink. What a pile of junk.
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: Not pleased
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the same product before for myself and gave some as gifts. It worked for years and finally gave out. I ordered another one. When it arrived it appeared the construction was not the same, did not seem as sturdy. It lasted for about two weeks and the motion detector no longer worked. Although the company was helpful, it didn't work as well as the older model and I was very disappointed. Purchased another brand and it is working fine.
customer_reviews.author: Judy

customer_reviews.title: Good quality, modern design, convenient to use
customer_reviews.text: I have been using the "simplehuman 9 oz. Sensor Soap Pump, Brushed Stainless Steel" for a year and half in my kitchen, and I ordered another one for my bathroom recently. It works perfect with Down soap. The only drawback is that it needs to recharge its battery every 2 months which is less than what I expected according to its ads. At first, like many other customers, I believed it is too expensive, but I found it compensates its price by reducing soap usage significantly.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Didn't last and support is poor
customer_reviews.text: The unit started to fail in a couple of months, it didn't work unless connected to the power, I contacted support and they just redirect me to their help page. Today it completely stopped working. Nice product but it doesn't last and support from simplehuman is very poor.
customer_reviews.author: Enrique Lira

customer_reviews.title: Multiple have stopped working after short time.
customer_reviews.text: I have owned three of these in 3 years, and 2 of them have stopped working. They do not charge, or turn on. For this price that should not be the case.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Tinker

customer_reviews.title: Prefer the compact, although I don't own the 9 oz one...
customer_reviews.text: I bought the "compact" battery operated version because I like that you can see how much liquid soap is left in the container. Also, I didn't like the look of the rechargeable version at least from the pictures. I've only owned it for a few weeks. The sensor has been working each time. One I keep Palmolive dish soap for the kitchen, and the other I keep hand soap for the guest bathroom.
customer_reviews.author: May (=^..^=)

customer_reviews.title: Dispenses a tremendous amount of soap, unreliable garbage
customer_reviews.text: I THREW IT OUT, rather than spend a ton on all the soap it wastes. The unit is JUNK garbage. Dispenses a huge amount of soap no matter where you place your hands. Consequently it consumes a a tremendous amount of soap. Because the unit is GARBAGE, there is no way to tell how much soap is in the unit. Simple Human cut the cost of production and provides no window to see the internal soap level. Terrible product.
customer_reviews.author: fredseth

customer_reviews.title: Half of the soap you put in there is destined to go straight to the sink.
customer_reviews.text: This is a beautiful looking product but the sensor is ALWAYS picking up false readings, at least once or twice every time I'm in the bathroom but nowhere close to where the sensor should pick up movement. It's not like automated soap dispensers are cutting edge technology--not sure why a $50 product can't differentiate between a hand moving under the sensor and shadows.
customer_reviews.author: Stilly

customer_reviews.title: Read The Reviews Regarding Reliability!
customer_reviews.text: I loved the first one so I got three more for the whole house. One was dead out of the box, another died in about six months. Having bought four, I have two that work. They work well if the soap isn't abnormally thick (like all USB rechargeables, they're not strong), they are mostly metal, and they look good. But for $60 a 50/50 reliability rate is inexcusable.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Harrison

customer_reviews.title: Good product with design flaws
customer_reviews.text: This soap dispenser works well but with a couple of design flaws that should be corrected. The funnel opening for filling the dispenser quickly fills when you fill the dispenser and overflows onto the surrounding rim. Also, it is impossible to tell if the dispenser is turned on or not. The charging cord is a usb type charger which requires that the dispenser be placed near either my computer of my charging station neither of which is near a sink to catch any soap which accidently may be discharged while charging. A simple voltage transformer would greatly be appreciated.
customer_reviews.author: Robert J. Jurman

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic product in every way.
customer_reviews.text: Found this product to be fantastic in every way. It’s small, clear back so you can see how much soap is in the dispenser, has an adjustment for how much soap you want which is easily done through the plus and a minus, the sensor is excellent. I have mine on my kitchen sink and find I’m using it all the time now, just swiping my hand across it and it works every time. I am using their soap and had no problem with it clogging. The materials do say not to use sulfate formula soaps.Six different fragrance soaps are available, with one being no fragrance. I would highly recommend this
customer_reviews.author: S BROWN

customer_reviews.title: Quick fix to try before u through it out...
customer_reviews.text: This product worked as specified. I read all of the reviews before I purchased this item so I was aware of the issues purchasers had & I still purchased it. First we use Dawn & not recommended soap which may have cause our issue. Just short of a year of usage & it wouldn’t dispense soap. The sensor worked & the motor runs but no soap! If ur unit gets to this condition try removing batteries & bottom 2 screws. Carefully lift bottom just enough to view motor & pulleys. I found that o ring that ran between the 2 pulleys had slip off. After I reseated the o ring around both pulleys & reassembled the dispenser works.
customer_reviews.author: NorthWoods

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: This product looks good but it is so annoying. It constantly drips soap even after I remove my hand from under the sensor. I have soap running down my vanity and drawers. I tried to make it work, but using s small glass disk under the spout but it continues to leak at odd times. I waited to long too return it, I’ll just throw it out,
customer_reviews.author: Silvia

customer_reviews.title: Sucks the life out of batteries
customer_reviews.text: I had trouble deciding how many stars to give this product. We have three of them and we loved the idea of them at first, but they just haven’t delivered. The pros: sensors are sensitive. Cons: not easy to modulate the amount of soap to be dispensed. But my biggest complaint pertains to batteries. I cannot BELIEVE how often we need to change the batteries. And ours is a house of three adults not playing with soap. This is just irritating. My advice, try another brand. This is a dog.
customer_reviews.author: Amy Hammond Hagberg

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t work from the beginning
customer_reviews.text: I just received this and it doesn’t work unless it’s plugged in, even after charging all night long and using the recommended soap. I guess I’ll go through the process of contacting SimpleHuman for technical support and/or a warranty exchange. Very frustrated and dissatisfied with such an expensive product.
customer_reviews.author: Danae

customer_reviews.title: Dispenses an unpredictable amount of soap
customer_reviews.text: In theory, you can adjust how much soap is dispensed by this unit by holding your hand closer or further from the spout. In practice, it's very unpredictable and despite my best efforts to be consistent I get too little or way too much soap. Other units that just have an adjustment for the volume are much better. Aside from that, it's OK: seems reasonably sturdy and attractive enough.
customer_reviews.author: Martin P

customer_reviews.title: Lasted less than 1 1/2 years. Bought it in April 2018.
customer_reviews.text: I love the look of the dispenser. It worked fairly well. However, it died on me a few weeks ago. I thought it might be the batteries, so changed the batteries. Light turned green, than it turned red and then it stop working after a few minutes. So I changed the batties with another set of new battries, and it would not turn on. I had my husband change the batteries and check the batteries life. Everything was good, but the dispenser would not turn on. So sadly, I will have to get rid of it. I was hoping it would last longer than it did.
customer_reviews.author: AvoGirl

customer_reviews.title: Thought I’d get more than 3 months use out of it.
customer_reviews.text: Well after 3 months it’s dead. No life at all. Kind of shocked based on previous reviews and price but I guess I was unlucky. Called support and they send you an email with troubleshooting tips you have to try in order to proceed. Did those steps which did nothing. So now I wait for the next email which I’m suppose to receive a packing label to send it in for repair. So besides this product failing in 3 months I’m shocked with a repair process!?!? Really? Why not just send me a new one and once I receive it I’ll send back the dead one. That’s what most companies do. 🙄
customer_reviews.author: SR

customer_reviews.title: Leaks from bottom.
customer_reviews.text: I loved this pump, but it started leaking 3 months after purchase. Makes me sad.
customer_reviews.author: Alleykat

customer_reviews.title: Missing items and defective
customer_reviews.text: I think when people return stuff to Amazon, Amazon doesn't check, so we got a defective item and a missing charger for ours. We can't return it because I was dumb and didn't check it when I got it and give it to my mom, who brought it back to Taiwan to use in her house. She didn't open it until she got back. Make sure you check what that you got all the accessories and your product is not defective.
customer_reviews.author: Cindy

customer_reviews.title: When soap does not dispense
customer_reviews.text: Simple fix when soap will not come out: Press and hold the power button down for 5 seconds. Wipe the sensor lens clean. We recommend using rubbing alcohol and a microfiber cloth to do so. Press the power button for 1 second to turn the unit on. Completely cover the sensor window and tap the power button quickly 3 times. Note that this will make the pump run continuously until the sensor window is uncovered.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth R.

customer_reviews.title: Batteries don't last.
customer_reviews.text: We purchased these and they lasted about 6 months with the first set of batteries, three months with the second set, and then we stopped using them because it seemed like we were having to change the batteries every time we used it. Also, it doesn't work well with regular soap, even if it's watered down. You have to pay ridiculous prices for their special soap. Would not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: CEL

customer_reviews.title: Faulty sensor after a year of usage
customer_reviews.text: This product looks great, but after a year of use (I bought it on Jan 21, 2019, and today is Dec 7, 2019), the product started to dispense the soap by itself non-stop, I had to turn it off. I cleaned the sensor, charged the battery fully, but it still doesn't work. DONT BUY!
customer_reviews.author: socheath

customer_reviews.title: Small footprint, reliable features
customer_reviews.text: Love this product. Best of the three similar I have used. Like the amount of soap dispensed. Looks good on the counter and dispenses reliably. Easy to fill and like the feature that I can see amount of soap remaining. Small footprint on the counter taking up little space. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia Williams

customer_reviews.title: Worth the $$
customer_reviews.text: Love these...splurged and got them in all my bathrooms and kitchen. I love that there are no batteries !!! The charging is so easy. One funny thing is that if a water drop hangs on by the sensor it can be tripped and appear to squirt soap for no reason. Also make sure you pick it up from behind if you're wiping up underneath it or you WILL get soap on the back of your hand ! It's REALLY nice to be hands free with the soap when hands are dirty from gardening, food prep, or whatever mess your making...Paired that with a touch free faucet and it totally works !
customer_reviews.author: S

customer_reviews.title: Eats batteries
customer_reviews.text: This replaced another Simply Human pump that eventually gave up the ghost (3-4 years?). I liked the original, I don't know why but this newer one goes thru batteries. Despite that I am contemplating ordering another one for the bathroom. Follow up: 3.5 years down the road and it still keeps on a'chuggin; but as I said earlier - it eats batteries. Three, maybe four battery changes per year. My first one didn't demonstrate that appetite. I'm still thinking about ordering a second one for the bathroom.
customer_reviews.author: Fox

customer_reviews.title: Love the variable soap dispensing
customer_reviews.text: This is definitely an upgrade from the Simplehuman rechargeable we bought two years ago, which still works just fine. We got this one to replace a battery operated one in the guest bath. I like the more modern look and I really love the variable soap dispensing based on where you place your hand. I have to tell guests how to use the variable dispensing if they are going to stay awhile, but it is easy to understand with the markings on the front. I would like some way to see how much soap is left. I like how easy it is to fill versus the previous model and other automatic countertop dispensers I have owned.
customer_reviews.author: Nodewalker

customer_reviews.title: Great dispensers; put one at each sink!
customer_reviews.text: I love these dispensers. I have one at each sink in the house now, and have given a few of them as gifts to family too. We use Mrs. Meyer's liquid soap with these and haven't had any issues. I've also stocked all of them with rechargeable batteries (at 4 batteries in each, this is a little expensive), and they are going strong. I love the idea of eliminating a germ transfer point in soap dispensers you have to physically touch. These puppies do that, and even let you set the amount of soap that gets dispensed each time. Much more flexible and less messy than an ordinary pump.
customer_reviews.author: Clayton M.

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I was mostly happy with this product till it completely died on me. Contacted Simplehuman and they told I could send it in for repair. It's not even a year old and can't really go without a soap dispenser while they decide whether it's repairable or they need to replace it. Pretty disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas J. Perri

customer_reviews.title: Inconsistent quality
customer_reviews.text: 2 and 1/2 stars to fairly reflect review. Purchased two. Two months later one stopped working entirely. Inconsistent quality control. Now I will have to spend an inordinate amount of time on hold while juggling work for the purposes of “troubleshooting” a product that should be replaced at this price.
customer_reviews.author: D

customer_reviews.title: Defective Simple Human product, says an aircraft mechanic
customer_reviews.text: My wife bought 3 of these for our new home in Oct 2016. We have had to replace the batteries no fewer than 4 times each. I have read many other reviews saying the units stopped working after as few as 10 days. I think those consumers will find it has already burned through a set of batteries - hard to believe I know. The product is defective, don't buy!! $110.00 worth of product will now go in the trash after 3 months if simple human does not stand behind the product and refund our money. I will keep you up to date on Simple Human customer Service...
customer_reviews.author: Dean Morgan

customer_reviews.title: Didn't last long
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to like this ...and I did...while it worked. I bought 4 of these for my home and every one of them stopped working within a few months. All of them. Two of them began dispensing soap every minute or so, creating a huge mess when no one was around. Very disappointed and I'm out a bit of money. never again
customer_reviews.author: TheOdyssey

customer_reviews.title: Not worth $50!!
customer_reviews.text: Where do I start. The lid does not securely shut, so don't accidentally knock it over or soap will spill everywhere. I was willing to overlook this because the look of it is quite stylish and matched our kitchen. But, here I am only 3 month later and the motion sensor won't work. I had it charging for 24 hours, it worked for 3 uses and then stopped. I am super disappointed and never expected this type of a defectiveness from a simplehuman product. The brand is what made me think, great quality and would make up for the expensiveness of it. I will be throwing it in the trash along with the almost $50 I paid for it.
customer_reviews.author: Terri

customer_reviews.title: Stops working
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this and it stopped working after three days .. do not buy
customer_reviews.author: erin everly

customer_reviews.title: Automatic dispenser could be better if was generation before
customer_reviews.text: The previous generation, which I own is arguably a better design. It allowed for user control on descending rate whereas this has automatic small dispense (hold hand high to nozzle) or large dispense (hold hand low to nozzle). Additionally, the cap closure disk creates an air vacuum effect on full soap refill where the air pressure prevents it from resting flat. It was also better when you could see through the clear back wall to see the soap level. Can’t do that on this model.
customer_reviews.author: Jamie Bissonnette

customer_reviews.title: Not bad
customer_reviews.text: So far i have had no issues. If you get in its dispensing range (on purpose or by accident) it will dispense. So be aware. It is only just over 6” tall. I was expecting something a little taller, by impression of pic. The solution they so kindly include only fills up the reservoir just under half and smells woodsy. Not to my liking. I am a female household of one. A choice would promote better. No drips.
customer_reviews.author: P. Hustead

customer_reviews.title: Smaller than I would have liked
customer_reviews.text: I got this soap dispenser to replace my old Simplehuman that I had for years. It had gotten pitted and looked terrible. My old one was larger which I prefer. This one seems to be made of cheaper plastic. I really like Simplehuman and will continue to use their products but wish I could find one of the old models to purchase. They were better. I stayed away from the rechargeable one, which I would have preferred, given the bad reviews on that product.
customer_reviews.author: T. Langan

customer_reviews.title: Would not recommend
customer_reviews.text: I usually love Simplehuman products, but this is definitely not up to standard. Stopped working after about a month. Battery would charge and last for only 5 minutes and it would completely die. Poor quality, and I cannot return the product because I am outside the 30 day window. Just as well flush $60 down the drain. Read all of the recent reviews like mine, the product is cheaply made and will not last long! Be warned!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Hard to use and / or doesn't work
customer_reviews.text: For $40 I thought I would be getting a great kitchen soap dispenser from simple human to replace a basic pump dispenser that was looking kind of aged. This one is horrible. When I try to get soap to come out it either doesn't dispense at all, or squirts a simple small bit, which is nowhere near enough to wash a dish. There is no way to get a stream of soap to use on a cloth to wash a few dishes. This works more like a hand soap dispenser, not dish soap, when it works at all.
customer_reviews.author: booklover99

customer_reviews.title: Great product (so far)
customer_reviews.text: I finally un-packaged and set up this no-touch soap dispenser, and it's everything I hoped it would be. It's very small and unobtrusive, and works perfectly (so far). If it continues to work this well for a reasonable period of time (it has a two year warranty), it will be perfect. Time will tell. Update 8-16-2020: Simplehuman gel hand soap refills were hard to find, and even Simplehuman was temporarily out of stock. After some research, I tried a Method Gel Hand Soap Refill (from Target), and it's proved to be a very good alternative. It's a liquid, not a gel, and the volume setting will need adjusting, but it's an excellent substitute.
customer_reviews.author: NJ Engineer

customer_reviews.title: Elegant soap dispenser-perfect for stainless steel kitchens.
customer_reviews.text: What an elegant soap dispenser!!! It’s beautiful and so easy to use. I got it as a gift for my sister after using one in the bathroom at my chiropractor’s office. It looks fantastic in my sister’s kitchen, with all of her stainless steel appliances and stainless steel sink. Awesome gift! It came as a set with the lavender soap. The lavender soap is very nice with a subtle fragrance.
customer_reviews.author: P. Young

customer_reviews.title: Best home soap dispenser I have ever owned
customer_reviews.text: The quality of the unit is exceptional. It is solidly built with no flimsy battery door (there is no battery door), soap compartment cover, or dispenser nozzle. The built-in rechargeable battery has lasted for several months when I have the minimal amount of soap dispensed, and is easily recharged with a magnetically attached charging connector. A truly nice feature allows for more or less soap to be dispensed depending where the hand is placed under the nozzle. Excellent product.
customer_reviews.author: W. Seipel

customer_reviews.title: Holds very little soap
customer_reviews.text: Does not hold enough soap and is hard to refill. Don’t overfill or you’ll never get the lid on. Considering this is for the kitchen where you are washing your hands more often during meal preparation. Also the rechargeable battery does not last long at all. I might get 10 to 15 hand washes before unit stops working and needs recharging. Very annoying especially when you have food all over your hands that need to be cleaned. Unit is very well constructed and looks nice with all the other stainless appliances. Would not recommend at this time. Maybe I got a defective one. Good luck!
customer_reviews.author: William

customer_reviews.title: Where has this been all my life?
customer_reviews.text: Awesome, stylish, effective soap dispenser! I bought the recharging type & love it! In the days of CCP 🦠 this is a must have because it is touchless. I like the soap quantity feature- you can place your hand close to the top for normal amount of soap and lower your hand when a larger amount of soap is needed. I plan on purring these in all the bathrooms as well as kitchen.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous

customer_reviews.title: Works well and looks great
customer_reviews.text: We have three of these and the Polished Stainless fits perfect with fixtures that are polished chrome. The sensor pumps works very well and like the variable amount of soap dispensed based on how close or far from the spout the hand is placed. Easy to fill. Should probably include instructions to get serial number before filling with liquid soap. Learned that after the first one when I went to register the product. Soap doesn't seem to sud much unless have a good full shot of soap. We'll see how long they last, but so far so good. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: Flying High

customer_reviews.title: I want to love it
customer_reviews.text: What I like about it, it is rechargeable so no batteries to replace, better on the environment. I bought this one for dish soap and have a different model for hand soap. I have them both next to the kitchen sink. The downside is this model seems to be more sensitive than the other so sometimes it goes off when you are near it or turn the sink on. Also, I don't like that I can't see the soap level inside and that the lid doesn't stay on as well as the other model. Regardless, I am keeping it mainly because of the rechargeable feature.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie Hardee-Pruitt

customer_reviews.title: Product is not reliable
customer_reviews.text: Sensor is terrible , bought 3 units, yesterday 1 out of 3 not working. Looking for a better quality product to purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Mabel Y

customer_reviews.title: Defective produce/ delays in getting refund after return
customer_reviews.text: I have to return this product because the battery was not charging. Two days after receiving it, I returned it August 12 2020, which was approved by Amazon. Now is September 21st and Amazon reports my refund is on transit. DO NOT BUY THIS SOAP DISPENSER, besides that is a defective product, if you have to returned it, you might not get your refund!
customer_reviews.author: Judith F. Morales

customer_reviews.title: Terrible product, poor quality.
customer_reviews.text: We bought three after seeing at a friends house. One just quit working, the second on randomly dispenser soap, and the third is acting up. Terrible quality, we do not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Richard O.

customer_reviews.title: You Can Still Get It Fixed from SimpleHuman - 1 Year Warranty
customer_reviews.text: We purchased our SimpleHuman Touch-Free Sensor Liquid Soap Pump back in Jan 2020 and it stopped working in late March 2020. The Amazon return policy had expired, so we decided to go directly to the Manufacturer and they agreed to send us a free shipping label and sent it to them directly since it was within the 1 year warranty. Since they could not fix it themselves they shipped me a new one and that one works great. Great customer service is always going to us coming back to make more purchases.
customer_reviews.author: "rpb59"

customer_reviews.title: Works Great AND Looks Nice
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful dispenser! Smaller footprint works well in tight spaces. It looks nicer than the large plastic dispensers I use in some places in my house. Rechargeable -- which is very convenient and cuts down on battery waste. My favorite feature is that I can get more or less soap per squirt simply by placing my hands closer or further from the spout.
customer_reviews.author: P. Charles

customer_reviews.title: Best Purchase yet
customer_reviews.text: My husband loves this thing! I don't have an unsightly dish soap bottle on the sink and its nice to access soap if both hands are dirty. Simple human is a great brand, which is why we purchased this particular one. We have other items from this company and enjoy them without complication. This model does eat up batteries if you have cheap ones in there, FYI
customer_reviews.author: Victory Rider

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money
customer_reviews.text: This dispenser is expensive but worth it. It looks much nicer than cheap plastic dispensers. Motion sensor works great and you can adjust how much soap is dispensed by where you place your hand. Rechargeable battery is nice. We use the dispenser all the time in the kitchen and the battery lasted about six months before needing a charge. Only complaint is that it is almost impossible to get the serial number for registration. Recommend doing that before putting soap in. Have to look up through window in the bottom.
customer_reviews.author: Seattle EJP

customer_reviews.title: The quality has gone down. And is it that difficult to manufacture it properly?
customer_reviews.text: I bought it first in 2017. It was okay. So bought another one, which stopped working before the first one. Since the first one was still okay, I got another one in it's place. But then both died. Still got a third one, and this April right when the hand soaps were out of stock everywhere this one squirted a full bottle/ tank of soap out by itself !!. So the question- is it that difficult to manufacture it properly, especially considering the price being charged?
customer_reviews.author: NP

customer_reviews.title: What you see is not necessarily what you get
customer_reviews.text: The item was sold as having a “brushed” finish. The pictures show it with a brushed finish. My order says “brushed”. As can be seen in the attached photo the finish is polished. Polished wasn’t an option when I ordetedthe item. I gave the 1 star rating because I’m tired of companies misrepresenting their products.
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: Not worth $40.up
customer_reviews.text: The product cost is over priced this should fall at about $9.99/$10.00 to be exact, it requires 4 (AA) it's light weight and honestly disappointed the demo video had not mentioned it's operation functions as battery operated.
customer_reviews.author: JOSELYN

customer_reviews.title: Streamlined, sturdy device
customer_reviews.text: This is my second Simplehuman hands-free soap dispenser. I purchased my first one at least 5 years ago for my disabled husband to use in his bathroom. I recently added this second one for the caregivers to use in the kitchen because of Covid-19. Eliminates touching and they use paper towels to dry their hands. A win-win for everyone.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy G

customer_reviews.title: All 3 eventually failed.
customer_reviews.text: I bought 3 of these in a two year span (2 in one order and 1 separately). The first two did not work from the beginning and the third one just recently stopped working. What happened to this brand? For the premium price they charge, their products should perform better than the other brands. It seems like they are becoming the Range Rover of home and kitchen products... looks great but poor reliability..
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: We both love it and it works well
customer_reviews.text: So far we both love it and the motion sensor works well. Only have had it for a few weeks but seems to be built well. Charged it overnight before using. It is easy to fill without the mess. It can sense when you put a sponge below it to put soap on the sponge. Put hand near top for just a little soap or further down for more.
customer_reviews.author: Sylvester

customer_reviews.title: I've had this for a while and it is great
customer_reviews.text: This is such an improvement over the original old sensor soap pumps, I like the ease of filling, the ease of turning off (for when the housekeeper comes), and the ease of charging. The two selectable levels of soap dispensing are very convenient. I highly recommend this for the kitchen; my motive in getting was to keep fingers that touch raw chicken from touching the soap pump. I use Williams Sonoma liquid soap in it and it works just fine and smells nice.
customer_reviews.author: MJC

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money
customer_reviews.text: We have purchased THREE of these. Obviously we liked them so kept repurchasing when one would stop working. They are supposed to have 12 months of battery use. The latest one which we did not buy from Amazon (not this one) has now stopped working only 1 month after purchasing. It's always the same. The red light blinks which indicates battery low. Take batteries out, replace with same and it works for a few days then does the same thing again. Very frustrating as it does work well when working. We will go back to non automatic dispensers from now on.
customer_reviews.author: Jaquelin

customer_reviews.title: So good I bought another!
customer_reviews.text: Love, love, love my dispenser. In the time of Covid it’s important to not touch things with dirty hands and this helps. I love the way you can control the amount of soap dispensed by where you position your hands. Its very easy to refill and the charge lasts a long time. We use this one in the kitchen and love it so much I bought the foam version for the bathroom. I also have a Simple Human makeup mirror and I am impressed by their products and my one call to customer service resolved my issue in five minutes. (Issue was with the mirror, not the soap dispenser.)
customer_reviews.author: Cozette3

customer_reviews.title: Awful design and not water resistant
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been a fan of simple human products but this is a complete failure. I bought multiple units of this dispenser for the kitchen and bath and all of them stop working serveral times a week because of moisture. SH Customer service asked me to open the battery compartment and wipe dry the battery cap each time. That is ridiculous. Sometime multiple times a day. The whole point of this dispenser is for hands free operation and here I have to constantly use both hands to open it and clean it several times per week
customer_reviews.author: AJ

customer_reviews.title: Dispenses soap when you get close to i
customer_reviews.text: This dispenser is way to quick about dispensing soap. I set it on the back edge of the sink and any time I rinse a dish and am in the center of the sink, it dispenses soap. If I place a dish/plate in the sink, it dispenses soap. I also think it dispenses way too much soap and it is unfortunate you cannot limit the amount of soap being dispensed.
customer_reviews.author: CarrieInNaples

customer_reviews.title: Best soap dispenser, we have three now!
customer_reviews.text: We have three of these. The first one we bought a couple of years back for the kitchen. Recently we decided to buy two more to use in our master bath. The higher up you hand is to the nozzle, the less soap it gives you, brilliant! We have had zero issues and only use the manufactures soap. I like the mandarin soap and my wife likes the lavender one.
customer_reviews.author: Marc Melton

customer_reviews.title: Not what it seems
customer_reviews.text: Sensor works great, and the design is stylish, but the battery needs charging every other day and it only holds a small amount of liquid. It is also impossible to know if it is turned on or off unless you dispose a small amount of liquid soap - that is how you check. Drop it on the counter too hard and the base cracks.
customer_reviews.author: F.R.

customer_reviews.title: poor battery compartment
customer_reviews.text: I should have paid attention to other reviews, but I figured since it was SimpleHuman it would be okay. The dispenser does not dispense soap. The first time we put in the batteries, we had trouble getting it to work at all, and now, about every five or six squirts, you have to open the battery compartment and jiggle the batteries or switch them around. Really irritating especially since it was expensive. I suspect the battery compartment cover isn't tight enough. We are going to have to buy another one -- a different brand! I've had it with this one.
customer_reviews.author: Julie Rodakowski

customer_reviews.title: Great soap dispenser!
customer_reviews.text: We bought a cheaper, off brand, automatic soap dispenser for 1/3 the cost and well, you definitely get what you pay for. We've been eyeing this soap dispenser and decided to buy it, despite the bigger price tag. We should've bought this in the first place!!! It's design is modern, it's quiet when it dispenses, you can control the amount of soap dispenses, and you can see when it's time for it to be refilled. We loved it so much, we bought two!
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: Saw this soap dispenser reviewed on America's Test Kitchen and ordered it. It makes it so easy to wash your hands when they are covered by schmutz. It fits neatly behind the sink. You can adjust the amount of soap dispensed to your liking. You can see the level of soap and refill it easily. I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Kathy Smith

customer_reviews.title: Simple, Useful & Well Designed!
customer_reviews.text: Consistent dispensing of liquid gel hand soap, with no mess on the counter or dispenser. If your hands/wrists need less usage, this touch-free liquid soap dispenser is for you!👌 SimpleHuman products are good quality & thoughtfully designed to be useful. Thank you Amazon for accurate, careful packaged & fast delivery👍👍
customer_reviews.author: Bevo Caffè☕️

customer_reviews.title: REALLY GOOD
customer_reviews.text: The ONLY thing I don't like about this dispenser is the shiny chrome on top. I need to wipe it a lot to keep it looking nice. HOWEVER, it dispenses soap very quickly and is consistent every single time. I love that you can readily see how much soap is left. I have two other brands and this one is BY FAR the best one. It is not too large or too small. They want you to buy their soap as it is the right consistency - but if you thin some of the thicker soaps it will be OK. I love this dispenser.
customer_reviews.author: NotAvailable

customer_reviews.title: I LOVE IT
customer_reviews.text: I have the battery operated one in the kitchen, and it has a better control for the amount of soap that comes out. This one was to replace a different brand in my bathroom. I got it because it is small and fit better in the bathroom. The only way to adjust the soap flow is to put your hand closer to the top (less soap) or closer to the bottom (more soap). However, to begin I had soap that was way too thin and it shot soap every time my hand got close! This isn't the only SimpleHuman I have bought. It is a good brand.
customer_reviews.author: Donna H.

customer_reviews.title: Super Simply happy w/ Simple Human
customer_reviews.text: Our last Simple Human sensor pump lasted us over 10 years. Researched other manufactures before getting this one, and I'm very satisfied with the quality & options this one provides. I have large hands, and the lowest setting dispenses the perfect amount for me. This also allows us to not have to go through as much soap as before. Added bonus, is we use the generic Sam's Club clear soap, & it works perfect.
customer_reviews.author: ParatrooperG

product_meta.title: simplehuman 8 oz. Touch-Free Sensor Liquid Soap Pump Dispenser with Soap Sample, Brushed Nickel
product_meta.description:
Color:Brushed| Style Name:8 oz. Battery OperatedThis simplehuman touch-free sensor pump is the most efficient and easy way to wash your hands — no germs or smudges left behind. Perfect for small sinks or countertops, its high-efficiency pump provides fast and accurate soap dispensing in just 0.2 seconds. The silicone valve prevents messy drips and clogs. A wide opening makes refills fast, easy and mess-free. Use simplehuman soap for optimum pump performance.

BRAND STORY
We design tools that help people become more efficient at home.

Day to day life has room for improvement. That's the basic thinking behind simplehuman. Many activities in our daily routine are so basic that we take them for granted. Washing our hands, cleaning up after a meal, grooming and prepping our appearance. Through innovation and new technologies, we find ways to streamline these simple tasks. We call our products tools for efficient living.
feature_bullets: SPEED DISPENSE - Our high-efficiency pump dispenses soap in just 0.2 seconds.
PRECISE SENSING - The sensor has a precise trigger zone for accurate, high-speed activation.
NO MESSY DRIPS - Flexible silicone valve snaps shut to create a seal preventing messy drips.
VOLUME CONTROL - Easy-access control buttons allows for instant volume adjustment.
WIDE REFILL OPENING - Makes refills fast, easy, and spill-free.
ENERGY EFFICIENT - Lasts up to 1 year with 4 alkaline AA batteries (not included).
USE WITH ANY SOAP BRAND – Easily refill with your favorite brand of liquid soap or try simplehuman soap, formulated to have the optimum consistency for our sensor soap pumps.
2-YEAR WARRANTY - We use the best materials and solid engineering so our products will last in tough environments like your home — for years.
TOUCH-FREE SOAP - Ensures no germs or smudges are left behind - perfect for the kitchen or bathroom.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.1 out of 5 stars6,177 ratings4.1 out of 5 stars
